title: Asian stocks join Wall Street rally, brace for BOJ hike
summary: Asian markets rebounded, mirroring Wall Street's tech surge, as investors anticipate a Bank of Japan rate hike. U.S. inflation slowed to 2.7%, though analysts caution about data distortions. Central banks in Europe and Britain signaled a more cautious approach to future rate cuts, impacting currency and bond markets.

title: Are Anupam Rasayan shares poised for long-term gains on Jayhawk deal?
summary: Anupam Rasayan's stock surged following its $150 million acquisition of US-based Jayhawk Fine Chemicals. This strategic move grants Anupam a US manufacturing presence, enhancing its global CDMO capabilities and polymer portfolio. The deal, funded through internal accruals and structured equity, is expected to be EPS accretive from day one and significantly boost US export share.

title: Stocks in news: ICICI Prudential AMC, Meesho, Ola Electric, Bharti Airtel, Vodafone Idea
summary: Markets traded cautiously, ending flat as consolidation continues, influenced by global cues and currency concerns. Key stocks like Ola Electric, ICICI Prudential AMC, and Bharti Airtel are in focus due to promoter stake sales, IPO debut, and CFO appointment respectively. NTPC plans significant capacity expansion, while Vodafone Idea raised funds for network investment.

title: Pre-market action: Here's the trade setup for today's session
summary: Nifty consolidated with a weak bias on Thursday, closing marginally lower. Analysts suggest the short-term trend remains choppy, with the 25,700 level appearing vulnerable. Foreign portfolio investors and domestic institutional investors showed net buying activity.

title: Meesho m-cap tops Rs 1 lakh cr in seven sessions after its listing
summary: E-commerce platform Meesho's market capitalization surged past ₹1 lakh crore within seven sessions of its listing, closing Thursday at ₹234 per share. This significant growth, up 37% since its December 10th debut, is attributed to its focus on Tier 2 and 3 city consumers and a robust, asset-light business model generating positive cash flows.

title: Sebi strikes a 'balance' in fee change; AMCs, brokers rally
summary: Asset management and broking stocks surged on Thursday following Sebi's revised mutual fund fee structure and broking fee caps. The regulator's less severe overhaul, with reduced expense ratio cuts and lower brokerage fee limits, led to a relief rally, with several AMC and brokerage firms seeing significant gains.

title: Japan’s MUFG to invest $4.45 billion on Shriram Finance in biggest FDI in Indian financial services
summary: Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group is set to invest $4.45 billion for a 20% stake in Shriram Finance, marking the largest FDI in India's financial services sector. This strategic move paves the way for an eventual acquisition, with MUFG aiming to increase its holding and gain majority control over time.

title: ECB holds interest rates at 2% for a fourth time
summary: The European Central Bank has held interest rates steady for the fourth time. Inflation is near the bank's target. The euro zone economy is showing resilience. New forecasts suggest economic growth will strengthen. Inflation is expected to return to the 2% target in 2028. Other central banks like the Bank of England and Federal Reserve have cut rates.

title: ICICI Pru AMC could gain up to 10-20% on debut
summary: ICICI Prudential Asset Management's IPO saw a strong subscription, indicating a likely firm market debut with potential listing gains of 10-20%. Analysts suggest the stock could list above ₹2,500, with some assigning a 'Buy' rating and a price target of ₹3,000. The company's strong fundamentals and industry tailwinds support long-term growth prospects.

title: Stock Radar: Profit booking in SBI stock after November highs, Shivangi Sarda advises buy on dips
summary: State Bank of India (SBI) stock has broken out of a falling channel on daily charts, signaling potential upside. Experts suggest short-term traders can buy for a target above Rs 1,000 in the next 2-3 weeks, with a stop loss below Rs 955.

title: Airtel rings in rights issue, shuffles senior leadership
summary: Bharti Airtel's board has approved calling the remaining ₹15,740 crore from a rights issue. This move aims to cut debt and strengthen the company's balance sheet. The board also approved a top management rejig. Shashwat Sharma will become the new CEO from January 1. Gopal Vittal will transition to executive vice chairman. Akhil Garg is the new CFO.

title: HDFC, BoB raise $1.5 billion from overseas loan market
summary: HDFC Bank and Bank of Baroda have collectively secured $1.5 billion in overseas loans, bolstering their liquidity amidst stabilizing interest rates. HDFC Bank raised $1 billion through a three-and-a-half-year loan, while BoB secured $500 million via a five-year pact, with MUFG and HSBC involved in the transactions.

title: Nifty 50, Sensex today: What to expect from Indian stock market in trade on December 19
summary: Indian equities lack direction as traders await a decisive market move. Key levels for the Sensex and Nifty are highlighted, with critical support at 84,100 for Sensex and 25,700 for Nifty. Bank Nifty faces consolidation, signaling potential volatility ahead.

title: Shares to buy or sell: Chandan Taparia recommends three stocks to buy and sell today - 19 December 2025
summary: Chandan Taparia has recommended three stocks to buy or sell today, 19 December 2025 - &nbsp;Tech Mahindra, Hindalco Industries, and Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders.

summary: Stocks to watch: Ola Electric, BPCL, Swiggy, and HCL Tech are some of the stocks that will remain in focus on Friday, 19 December 2025.

title: ICICI Prudential AMC share price LIVE: 5th ICICI group firm set to list today — GMP signals 24% listing gains
summary: ICICI Prudential AMC share price LIVE: Shares of ICICI Prudential AMC are set to list in the Indian stock market today, December 19. ICICI Prudential AMC IPO received bumper demand from investors and garnered a strong premium in the grey market ahead of listing.

title: Stocks to buy: Raja Venkatraman's top picks for 19 December
summary: Market expert Raja Venkatraman shares his top three stock picks to buy today, 19 December. Discover his exclusive picks and analysis to inform your investment strategy.

summary: ICICI Prudential AMC IPO listing date today — Experts see a positive debut of shares on D-Street, if the Indian stock market opens on a positive note on Thursday, 19 December 2025.&nbsp;

summary: AUSTRALIA-STOCKS/ MIDDAY:Australian shares climb as banks, real estate gain on softer US inflation

summary: MarketSmith India reveals its top stock recommendations for today, 19 December. Get expert insights into the best-performing stocks to guide your investment decisions.

title: Tender Offer Threatens Squeeze on Topix 500’s Most-Shorted Stock
summary: Tsuruha Holdings Inc. has become one of the most heavily shorted stocks in Japan as investors position for its tender-offer-driven rally to fade. But analysts warn that this strategy may end in a short squeeze if the drug store operator’s earnings beat expectations.

title: Takeda Rises After AI-Developed Psoriasis Pill Trial Success
summary: Takeda Pharmaceutical Co. rose the most in seven months on Friday after the drugmaker said its oral psoriasis drug zasocitinib proved safe and effective in late-stage trials, marking a milestone in its effort to treat the incurable skin condition.

title: Former BluSmart executive leads Refex bid to salvage bankrupt EV ride hailer
summary: Refex Mobility, now led by former BluSmart CEO Anirudh Arun, is vying for the electric cab operator's assets.&nbsp;

title: TikTok signs deal to house US operations in new joint venture with Oracle, Silver Lake & MGX
summary: TikTok’s US operations will be housed in a new joint venture, according to a memo sent to employees by CEO Shou Zi Chew.

title: GPT Infra shares in focus on Rs 1,804-crore contract from Mumbai Municipal Corp
summary: GPT Infraprojects secured a significant Rs 1,804 crore contract from the Municipal Corp of Greater Mumbai for a flyover project. This follows a recent Rs 54 crore order from South Eastern Railways. The company's robust order book and strong Q2 performance indicate positive future growth prospects.

title: Vegetable seller Stanbik Agro shares to list today. Check GMP ahead of debut
summary: Stanbik Agro, a vegetable and fruit seller, is set to list on the BSE SME platform on December 19. The Rs 12 crore IPO, which closed on December 16, saw modest subscription. Grey market indicators suggest a flat opening, with shares likely to trade near the IPO price of Rs 30.

title: Ashwini Container shares to list today. Check GMP ahead of debut
summary: Ashwini Container Movers is set for its NSE SME debut on December 19, with grey market signals suggesting a modest listing around Rs 147-148. The Rs 71 crore IPO saw decent subscription, particularly from non-institutional investors.

title: Exim Routes shares to debut today. Here's what GMP indicates
summary: Exim Routes is poised for a robust debut on the NSE SME platform on December 19, with grey market premiums indicating significant investor interest. The company's technology-driven platform for cross-border trade in recyclable materials has attracted strong demand, evidenced by its oversubscribed IPO. Proceeds will fuel platform development and working capital.

title: Ashish Kacholia-backed multibagger stock to turn ex-split on Dec 22; last day to qualify for eligibility. Do you own?
summary: Knowledge Marine & Engineering Works stock will trade ex-split on December 22, 2025. Investors must buy shares by December 19 to benefit from the stock split. The company is subdividing its shares in a 1:2 ratio. Each Rs 10 share will become two Rs 5 shares. Ace investor Ashish Kacholia holds a significant stake in the company.

title: Positive Breakout: These 10 stocks cross above their 200 DMAs
summary: As long as the stock is priced above the 200-day SMA on the daily timeframe, it is generally considered to be in an overall uptrend

title: Last day to buy shares of Canara Robeco AMC to receive first-ever dividend after listing
summary: Investors have a limited window to secure Canara Robeco Asset Management Company's maiden interim dividend of Rs 1.50 per share. To be eligible for this payout, which follows the company's listing, shares must be purchased by December 19, as the record date is December 22. This dividend signifies a significant milestone for the asset management firm.

title: Wall Street closes higher fueled by tech rally, soft inflation data
summary: Indian markets saw a positive trend on Thursday. Major US stock indexes closed higher. This was driven by lower-than-expected inflation figures. Hopes for interest rate cuts by the Federal Reserve increased. Chipmaker Micron's strong forecast also boosted sentiment. This indicated robust demand for AI technology. Consumer discretionary stocks and tech stocks performed well.

title: Stocks to buy for short term: Ajit Mishra of Religare Broking picks 3 shares on bullish technical signals; do you own?
summary: The Indian stock market has declined for four sessions amid a falling rupee and delayed trade deals. Ajit Mishra of Religare Broking recommends focusing on disciplined trading and suggests three stocks, including Infosys and Ramco Cements, which show signs of potential reversals.

title: Stock market today: Trade setup for Nifty 50, India VIX to ICICI Prudential AMC IPO — eight stocks to buy or sell
summary: Stock market today: Experts have recommended eight stocks to buy today — GMDC, Hindustan Copper, Sudeep Pharma, Bank of Baroda, Divi's Lab, HBL Engineering, BSE, and Firstcry

title: Volatility index India VIX plunges 15% in December to hit a record low; what does it indicate about Indian stock market?
summary: A falling VIX indicates traders are not aggressively buying put options, reflecting market confidence and reduced hedging activity. Low VIX levels suggest stability but warn of potential volatility spikes due to unexpected events, while option-selling strategies gain favor in this environment.

summary: Buy or sell: Vaishali Parekh recommends three intraday stocks to buy today — Ashok Leyland, Sandur Manganese and Iron Ores, and Hindustan Copper

title: Bitcoin Volatility Rises Ahead of $23 Billion Options Expiry
summary: Options are showing that Bitcoin is heading into the final weeks of 2025 under intense pressure, with around $23 billion in contracts set to expire next Friday that threaten to amplify already-elevated volatility.

title: 10 key things that changed for market overnight - Gift Nifty, US CPI data to BoE rate cut
summary: The Indian stock market is set to open higher on December 19, following four days of losses. Positive global cues and improved sentiment from US inflation data are boosting expectations for a recovery in the benchmarks Sensex and Nifty 50.

title: Three undervalued chemical stocks to add to your 2026 watchlist
summary: Here are three undervalued chemical stocks to consider. Some of these have a long-standing track record.

title: Breakout stocks to buy or sell: Sumeet Bagadia recommends five shares to buy today — 19 December 2025
summary: Breakout stocks to buy or sell: Sumeet Bagadia recommends five shares to buy today - Pricol, Sansera Engineering, Blue Star, Jindal Stainless, and Automotive Axles.

title: How Amazon's 8.5% layoff in Luxembourg raises difficult questions for Indian foreign workers
summary: Amazon’s decision to chop 8.5% or 370 employees at its unit in Luxembourg could pose an impossible situation for Indian foreign workers likely to be impacted. This is the tech giant's largest such job cut in the tiny European nation in around 20 years.&nbsp;

title: ED restores over  ₹300 crore for ex-employees of Kingfisher Airlines
summary: ED on 18 December said it has restituted funds worth more than  ₹300 crore towards long-pending dues of the former workers of now defunct Kingfisher Airlines.

title: Why is the stock market rising? Sensex jumps over 500 points, Nifty above 25,950; key factors behind the rally
summary: Indian stock markets surged on Friday. The Sensex and Nifty saw significant gains, reversing recent declines. This rally was fueled by encouraging U.S. inflation data. Lower inflation in America boosted global investor confidence. Expectations for Federal Reserve interest rate cuts in the coming year also increased. Asian markets mirrored this positive trend.

title: RBL Bank, MCX, Laurus Labs among 10 stocks that rallied up to 120% in 2025
summary: As 2025 concludes, a select group of BSE 500 companies defied market pressures, with L&T Finance leading gains over 120%. Aditya Birla Capital and RBL Bank also delivered strong returns, showcasing significant outperformance amidst sectoral churn and shifting investor preferences.

title: More zeros than multibaggers! India's SME IPO returns in 2025 crushed under heavy scrutiny
summary: India's SME IPO market experienced a significant downturn in 2025, with listing gains plummeting to 12.6% and over half of new listings trading below their IPO price. Tighter regulations, including price caps, and weak smallcap sentiment have curbed speculative trading, forcing a reset in investor expectations for quick profits.

title: Trump’s Fed Contenders: Divergent paths to a common goal of lower rates
summary: As Donald Trump weighs successors to Fed Chair Jerome Powell, Kevin Hassett, Christopher Waller and Kevin Warsh emerge as leading contenders with differing views on rates, reforms and the Fed’s role.

title: Lenskart shares rise 4% as Macquarie initiates with Outperform. Check target, upside potential
summary: Lenskart Solutions shares surged nearly 4% to Rs 427 after Macquarie initiated coverage with an Outperform rating and a Rs 530 target price, citing robust growth and a strong integrated supply chain. The company also reported a 20% year-on-year rise in consolidated profit after tax to Rs 102.22 crore in its first earnings post-IPO.

title: Growth or Value? Decoding the Winning Strategy Across Indian and Global Markets
summary: The growth-versus-value debate plays out differently across India, the US and global markets, shaped by valuations, cycles and monetary policy, making balance and timing key for HNIs.

title: At Rs 1.5 lakh crore, promoter selling breaks all records in 2025. Should stock market investors worry?
summary: Promoter selling has reached a record Rs 1.5 lakh crore in 2025. This significant selloff has led to a decline in private promoter shareholding to an eight-year low. Prominent business houses like Bharti Airtel and IndiGo have seen substantial promoter sales. While some view this as a sign of expensive valuations, experts suggest varied motivations behind these sales.

title: Buy, Sell or Hold: Nuvama maintains reduce rating on Voltas; Morgan Stanley maintains equal weight on HCL Technologies
summary: Brokerages offer selective advice on large-cap stocks. Analysts weigh current challenges against future growth in sectors like pharma and IT. Nuvama suggests a 'Reduce' on Voltas due to margin pressures. Citi is positive on Divi's Laboratories, seeing a 43% upside. Morgan Stanley rates HCL Technologies 'Equal Weight' following a new acquisition. These insights guide investors on potential stock movements.

title: TCS, Infosys, other IT stocks rise as Accenture reports 6% revenue growth in Q1, strong FY26 guidance
summary: Indian IT stocks saw gains on Friday. This followed Accenture's positive first-quarter results for fiscal year 2026. The global IT giant reported revenue growth and provided strong full-year guidance. This outlook is influencing sentiment across the IT services sector. Infosys, HCL Technologies, and TCS were among the gainers. New bookings and AI contributions also showed strength.

title: Shriram Finance shares in focus ahead of board meet on MUFG’s $4.45 billion investment
summary: Shriram Finance shares are in focus ahead of a board meeting to approve a proposed Rs 40,000 crore strategic investment by MUFG for a 20% stake. The deal, set to be India’s largest FDI in financial services, could strengthen capital access and support future growth.

title: Ola Electric shares rally 8% after Bhavish Aggarwal’s 3-day stake sale
summary: Ola Electric shares surged 7.7% to Rs 33.68 after promoter Bhavish Aggarwal sold shares worth Rs 324 crore to fully repay a Rs 260 crore loan. This move releases all pledged shares, eliminating a critical overhang and reinforcing the company's commitment to its strategic direction.

title: Bank of Japan raises interest rates to 30-year high, signals more hikes
summary: The Bank of Japan has taken a significant step by raising interest rates. This marks a major shift after decades of extensive monetary support and very low borrowing costs. The central bank's decision to increase short-term rates to 0.75% was unanimous. Governor Kazuo Ueda will provide further details at a press conference.

title: RIL shares in focus as consumer arm acquires majority stake in this nutrition brand
summary: Reliance Consumer Products has acquired a majority stake in Udhaiyams Agro Foods. This move strengthens Reliance's branded staples portfolio. Udhaiyam brings over three decades of experience in staples and packaged pulses. The promoters will continue to support growth. Morgan Stanley anticipates rating upgrades for Reliance Industries in 2026. The retail segment shows rapid scaling and quick commerce growth via JioMart.

title: HCL Tech shares in focus after $160 million HPE telco unit buy; Morgan Stanley bullish
summary: HCL Technologies has announced the acquisition of Hewlett Packard Enterprise’s Telco Solutions Business in an all-cash deal valued at up to $160 million, including performance-linked incentives. The move is aimed at strengthening HCLTech’s engineering- and AI-led telecom offerings, with brokerages expecting the impact on earnings to be limited.

title: Meesho shares decline 6% after 110% surge since listing; short squeeze triggers auction
summary: Meesho shares saw a 6.3% dip to Rs 220.50 after a nearly 110% surge post-IPO. A short squeeze forced over one crore shares into auction due to delivery shortfalls, exacerbated by a low free-float. The e-commerce platform's strong demand and UBS's 'Buy' rating have fueled its rapid ascent.

title: Vodafone Idea shares jump 2% after Rs 3,300 crore fundraise plan via NCDs by subsidiary
summary: Vodafone Idea shares saw an uptick on Friday after the telecom firm raised Rs 3,300 crore via secured NCDs issued by its subsidiary VITIL. The fundraise saw strong investor demand and is aimed at supporting capex and growth plans, reinforcing confidence in the telecom operator’s long-term strategy.

title: ICICI Prudential AMC share price makes bumper debut! Stock lists at  ₹2,600, surging 20% from IPO price
summary: ICICI Prudential AMC shares debuted on December 19, 2025, at  ₹2,600, a 20% premium to its IPO price. The company’s IPO was highly anticipated, receiving 39.17 times overall subscription, largely driven by institutional investors.

title: BoJ rate hike: What does the Bank of Japan's interest rate decision mean for the Indian stock market?
summary: After the BoJ interest rate decision, the Sensex jumped over 500 points, and the Nifty 50 reclaimed 25,970 on the upside, indicating that the policy decision was largely discounted in the market.

title: Nifty, Sensex open higher on Friday amid global central bank action and Bank of Japan rate hike
summary: The domestic equity markets opened with gains on Friday, tracking positive cues from Asian markets after the Bank of Japan (BoJ) raised interest rates to the highest level in 30 years.

title: Nikkei jumps 1.4% after Bank of Japan's rate hike decision
summary: Japanese stock markets reacted positively to the Bank of Japan's expected interest rate hike, with the flagship Nikkei 225 surging as much as 1.42% following the announcement.

title: KSH International IPO Allotment Status: Steps to check online even as issue remain undersubscribed; find latest GMP
summary: KSH International's IPO was undersubscribed at 0.83 times, with bids for 1.12 crore shares out of 1.36 crore offered. The allotment status will be finalized on December 19. The IPO aims to strengthen the company's balance sheet and includes debt repayment and machinery purchases.

title: Gold price today: Rates drop on MCX on profit booking as BoJ raises key policy rate by 25 bps
summary: Gold price today: MCX gold February futures were 0.56% down at  ₹1,33,772 per 10 grams around 9:10 am. MCX silver March futures were 0.26% lower at  ₹2,03,034 per kg at that time.

title: Bank of Japan Rate Decision Live: BoJ raises its key policy rate 25 bps to 0.75%, highest in 30 years
summary: Bank of Japan Rate Decision Live: The Bank of Japan (BOJ) has raised its key policy rate to 0.75%, its highest level since September 1995. The central bank increased the rate by 0.25 percentage points, taking the benchmark to a 30-year high, potentially rattling world markets.

title: The deepening rift between Silicon Valley and Dalal Street
summary: The AI-led rally has pushed US tech stocks to record highs, while India’s IT services firms face weak growth and lag the Nasdaq by over 40% on a rolling three-year basis.

title: Infosys, TCS, HCL Tech: Indian IT stocks gain after Accenture’s strong Q1 — What does it mean for Indian IT sector?
summary: Indian IT stocks are under scrutiny following Accenture's strong Q1 results, driven by AI demand. Revenue rose 6% to $18.7 billion, with solid bookings. Accenture maintained its full-year revenue growth guidance at 2%–5%.

title: Global VC FinSight Ventures sharpens India strategy with $150–160 million plan, also eyes secondaries
summary: The VC firm will split its focus evenly between fintech and commerce, and plans to deploy $150–160 million over the next two to three years.

title: Bangladesh gets a head start over India in export of weight-loss drugs to emerging markets
summary: As Indian drug giants rush to export weight-loss drug semaglutide in countries that don’t have patent exclusivity, they face an unlikely adversary in their neighbour.
